Name: Issue 335
Introduction: G'day everyone, welcome to issue #335 of Weekly Xamarin - an wrap-up of what's happening in the Xamarin and MAUI communities. As we all settle into the new year, there has been a MAUI preview 12 release! Time to get stuck into that and investigate all the goodness.  Have a app-tastic week. Kym

Articles.Title: Managing State in Comet
Articles.Description: 2nd part of the Comet series by David - this time digging into managing state in Comet with an overview of MVU.
Articles.Author: David Ortinau

Articles.Title: Lottie Animations by Iconscout
Articles.Description: A library of over 10,000 Lottie Animations for you to enhance your designs. Not free, but a good collection.

Articles.Title: Replicating an App Login Screen in Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: In this UI design, we have two separate pages for validating email and password.
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: Scanning and analyzing invoices using Xamarin.Forms and Azure
Articles.Description: How to easily scan and extract data from invoices using Azure Form Recognizer and Xamarin.Forms.
Articles.Author: Andreas Nesheim

Articles.Title: What Is Single Project in .NET MAUI?
Articles.Description: The .NET MAUI single project makes resource management across platforms a breeze‚Äîupload in one place, and it takes care of the rest!
Articles.Author: Leomaris Reyes

Articles.Title: MAUI: Hello World
Articles.Description: This blog post covers getting up and running with a new MAUI project.
Articles.Author: Boguslaw Blonski

Articles.Title: Deep Introduction to .NET MAUI Handlers Architecture
Articles.Description: One of the greatest improvements MAUI brings is to replace renderers by handlers. Here is an introduction to .NET MAUI handlers.
Articles.Author: Damien Doumer

Articles.Title: Edit Local Images/Text from a .NET MAUI Blazor Hybrid App
Articles.Description: With .NET 6 and the latest Visual Studio 2022 preview, developers can create a hybrid Blazor/.NET MAUI app that can work with local machines in ways that ordinary Blazor (web) apps can't. Blazor code can now browse local file systems and open up local files and edit them in native Windows apps, for example.
Articles.Author: David Ramel

Articles.Title: Sands of MAUI: Issue #40
Articles.Description: Sam breaks down all the MAUI News
Articles.Author: Sam Basu

Articles.Title: Exploring Multi-window Apps in .NET MAUI Preview 11
Articles.Description: Continuing to explore the Multi-Window aspects of .NET MAUI, Michael looks into opening and closing windows programmatically.
Articles.Author: Michael Ridland

Articles.Title: Build a game like Space Invaders using .NET Maui
Articles.Description: Learn how to build a game like Space Invaders using .NET Maui preview. You will learn about new components an some differences between Maui.Graphics.Skia verses SkiaSharp in Xamarin.Forms.
Articles.Author: Jon Nichols

Articles.Title: Prism and Other Client Technologies with Brian Lagunas
Articles.Description: What's your UX strategy? Carl and Richard talk to Brian Lagunas about his work on Prism, the UX framework that works WPF, Xamarin, and now the Uno Platform to build good-looking, consistent UX experiences. Brian talks about the challenges around simplifying the UX experience enough to make it easy to do the right thing, while still having enough functionality to not limit what your applications can do. The conversation also dives into web UX challenges and some of the tools that Brian has been working on for Infragistics in the same space.
Articles.Author: .NET Rocks!

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict: 289: App Publishing Road Blocks
Articles.Description: Frank is in a rush to try to get out an app into the app store in record time, but he runs up against those bumps that we have talked about so many times. We discuss his biggest road blocks.
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict

Articles.Title: The .NET MAUI Podcast Episode 104: ScreenMedia
Articles.Description: Another customer success story! ScreenMedia develops apps for a multitude of customers and find out how much fun they're having.
Articles.Author: .NET MAUI Podcast

Articles.Title: The .NET MAUI Podcast Episode 105: Not One But Two .NET MAUI Previews!
Articles.Description: Can you believe there were 2 .NET MAUI previews since our last episode? Come on in and listen and David Ortinau breaks all of the newness down.
Articles.Author: .NET MAUI Podcast

Articles.Title: .NET MAUI MVU With Comet: Getting Started in VS Code
Articles.Description: MVU (Model-View-Update) is a (new) design pattern that became popular because of SwiftUI and Flutter. Now it's also available for C# and .NET. More specifically, you can use it with .NET MAUI and build great cross-platform apps with it. Want to learn more and see how to get started? Watch this! [**.NET MAUI MVU With Comet: Getting Started in VS Code**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=52RmT2MIFzg) by [Gerald Versluis](https://twitter.com/jfversluis)
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: gRPC in MAUI apps part 2.
Articles.Description: Use gRPC in MAUI XAML Android and iOS Apps
Articles.Author: Carl Franklin

Articles.Title: Push Notifications: The Big Picture
Articles.Description: When I made the videos on how to implement push notifications, a lot of people had questions about how push notifications actually work. So I made a little video to talk about the logistics of push notifications; how they work and what to take into account. Hope this helps!
Articles.Author: Gerald Versluis

Articles.Title: Animating Controls in .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Have you been looking to add some pizzaz to your .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms apps? Look no further than the built in animation system in these frameworks. You can easily add simple animations in code in just a few lines of code, you can chain multiple animations together, or create your own custom animation and synchronize it with your MVVM code.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Shell for .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Today we look at exactly what Xamarin.Forms & .NET MAUI Shell are and why you may want to consider it for your application. We explain the history of shell, the structure it brings to your app, and features including simplified navigation with urls, and much more. [**üêö Shell for .NET MAUI & Xamarin.Forms - What, why, and how?!?!**](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dM4PhZAUhzU) by [James Montemagno](https://twitter.com/jamesmontemagno)
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Null Pointers 77: Creating Games with Xamarin Forms
Articles.Description: In this weeks episode we talk about making stunning mobile apps. Shaun tells us how he created Super Wordsearch with the help of tools like Skia Sharp and Lottie while using Xamarin Forms.
Articles.Author: Null Pointers

Articles.Title: Announcing .NET MAUI Preview 12
Articles.Description: .NET MAUI Preview 12 has shipped with lots of quality improvements, plus new features for Shell and dependency injection.
Articles.Author: David Ortinau

Articles.Title: Facebook SDK v12.2 for Xamarin.iOS Now Available
Articles.Description: Facebook SDK is now available for Xamarin developers offering updates to CoreKit, LoginKit, ShareKit, GamingServiceKit, and AudienceNetwork.
Articles.Author: Israel Soto
